title: Langton Matravers Walk Route

images.title: Langton Matravers Village Hall by Mike Faherty, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Langton Matravers Village Hall

images.title: Jim Champion / Footpath to Langton Matravers from the Priest's Way
images.caption: Footpath to Langton Matravers from the Priest's Way. This footpath leads straight to Garfield Lane in Langton Matravers, past Tom's Field campsite (on the left). The walkers are headed in the opposite direction to the Priest's Way on the limestone plateau.

images.title: Cliffs west of Seacombe Quarry, Langton Matravers by Phil Champion, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cliffs west of Seacombe Quarry, Langton Matravers

images.title: Phil Champion / Coast path towards Seacombe
images.caption: Coast path towards Seacombe. A beautifully maintained stretch of the South West Coast path as it descends relatively gently towards Seacombe

images.title: Children climbing at Dancing Ledge by Phil Champion, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Children climbing at Dancing Ledge

images.title: Hedbury Quarry, Isle of Purbeck by Phil Champion, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Hedbury Quarry, Isle of Purbeck

description: This pretty little village sits in a lovely spot close to the Dorset coast, near Swanage. This circular walk from the village visits some of the local highlights including Dancing Ledge, Worth Matravers and St Aldhelm's Chapel. The walk starts in the village and heads south through the countryside towards Dancing Ledge on the coast. Here you turn west along the South West Coast Path to Seacombe Cliff and the ancient St Aldhelm's Chapel. You then turn north to Emmetts Hill before turning east on country lanes to the neighbouring village of Worth Matravers. The final section takes you east along the Priest's Way to return to the village.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Back in the village you can enjoy some post walk rest and refreshment at The Kings Arms.
